TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EffectFactory extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The EffectFactory class defines the list of available Effects, and provides functionality to inspect and instantiate them.

remarks.para: The EffectFactory class defines the list of available Effects, and provides functionality to inspect and instantiate them. Some effects may not be available on all platforms, so before creating a certain effect, the application should confirm that the effect is supported on this platform by calling #isEffectSupported(String).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Sub New (javaReference As IntPtr, transfer As JniHandleOwnership)
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int javaReference, valuetype Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer) cil managed

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Function CreateEffect (effectName As String) As Effect
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Media.Effect.Effect CreateEffect(string effectName) cil managed
abstract member CreateEffect : string -> Android.Media.Effect.Effect override this.CreateEffect : string -> Android.Media.Effect.Effect

Docs.param: The name of the effect to create.
Docs.summary: Instantiate a new effect with the given effect name.

remarks.para: Instantiate a new effect with the given effect name.
The effect's parameters will be set to their default values.

Note that the EGL context associated with the current EffectContext need not be made current when creating an effect. This allows the host application to instantiate effects before any EGL context has become current.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the effect with the specified name is not supported or not known.

Docs.summary: Attempts to auto-fix the image based on histogram equalization.

remarks.para: Attempts to auto-fix the image based on histogram equalization.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
scale The scale of the adjustment. Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no adjustment, while 1 indicates the maximum amount of adjustment.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Replaces the background of the input frames with frames from a selected video.

remarks.para: Replaces the background of the input frames with frames from a selected video. Requires an initial learning period with only the background visible before the effect becomes active. The effect will wait until it does not see any motion in the scene before learning the background and starting the effect.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
source A URI for the background video to use. This parameter must be supplied before calling apply() for the first time. String, such as from android.net.Uri#toString Uri.toString()
If the update listener is set for this effect using Effect#setUpdateListener, it will be called when the effect has finished learning the background, with a null value for the info parameter.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Overlays a bitmap (with premultiplied alpha channel) onto the input image.

remarks.para: Overlays a bitmap (with premultiplied alpha channel) onto the input image. The bitmap is stretched to fit the input image.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
bitmap The overlay bitmap. A non-null Bitmap instance.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Adjusts the range of minimal and maximal color pixel intensities.

remarks.para: Adjusts the range of minimal and maximal color pixel intensities.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
black The value of the minimal pixel. Float, between 0 and 1.
white The value of the maximal pixel. Float, between 0 and 1.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the image.

remarks.para: Adjusts the brightness of the image.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
brightness The brightness multiplier. Positive float. 1.0 means no change; larger values will increase brightness.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the image.

remarks.para: Adjusts the contrast of the image.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
contrast The contrast multiplier. Float. 1.0 means no change; larger values will increase contrast.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Crops an upright rectangular area from the image.

remarks.para: Crops an upright rectangular area from the image. If the crop region falls outside of the image bounds, the results are undefined.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
xorigin The origin's x-value. Integer, between 0 and width of the image.
yorigin The origin's y-value. Integer, between 0 and height of the image.
width The width of the cropped image. Integer, between 1 and the width of the image minus xorigin.
height The height of the cropped image. Integer, between 1 and the height of the image minus yorigin.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Applies a cross process effect on image, in which the red and green channels are enhanced while the blue channel is restricted.

remarks.para: Applies a cross process effect on image, in which the red and green channels are enhanced while the blue channel is restricted.
Available parameters: None
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Applies black and white documentary style effect on image.

remarks.para: Applies black and white documentary style effect on image..
Available parameters: None
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Representation of photo using only two color tones.

remarks.para: Representation of photo using only two color tones.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
first_color The first color tone. Integer, representing an ARGB color with 8 bits per channel. May be created using android.graphics.Color Color class.
second_color The second color tone. Integer, representing an ARGB color with 8 bits per channel. May be created using android.graphics.Color Color class.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Applies back-light filling to the image.

remarks.para: Applies back-light filling to the image.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
strength The strength of the backlight. Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no change.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Applies a fisheye lens distortion to the image.

remarks.para: Applies a fisheye lens distortion to the image.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
scale The scale of the distortion. Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no distortion.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Flips image vertically and/or horizontally.

remarks.para: Flips image vertically and/or horizontally.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
vertical Whether to flip image vertically. Boolean
horizontal Whether to flip image horizontally. Boolean
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Applies film grain effect to image.

remarks.para: Applies film grain effect to image.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
strength The strength of the grain effect. Float, between 0 and 1. Zero means no change.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Converts image to grayscale.

remarks.para: Converts image to grayscale.
Available parameters: None
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Applies lomo-camera style effect to image.

remarks.para: Applies lomo-camera style effect to image.
Available parameters: None
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Inverts the image colors.

remarks.para: Inverts the image colors.
Available parameters: None
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Applies posterization effect to image.

remarks.para: Applies posterization effect to image.
Available parameters: None
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Removes red eyes on specified region.

remarks.para: Removes red eyes on specified region.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
centers Multiple center points (x, y) of the red eye regions. An array of floats, where (f[2*i], f[2*i+1]) specifies the center of the i'th eye. Coordinate values are expected to be normalized between 0 and 1.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Rotates the image.

remarks.para: Rotates the image. The output frame size must be able to fit the rotated version of the input image. Note that the rotation snaps to a the closest multiple of 90 degrees.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
angle The angle of rotation in degrees. Integer value. This will be rounded to the nearest multiple of 90.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Adjusts color saturation of image.

remarks.para: Adjusts color saturation of image.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
scale The scale of color saturation. Float, between -1 and 1. 0 means no change, while -1 indicates full desaturation, i.e. grayscale.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Converts image to sepia tone.

remarks.para: Converts image to sepia tone.
Available parameters: None
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Sharpens the image.

remarks.para: Sharpens the image.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
scale The degree of sharpening. Float, between 0 and 1. 0 means no change.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Rotates the image according to the specified angle, and crops the image so that no non-image portions are visible.

remarks.para: Rotates the image according to the specified angle, and crops the image so that no non-image portions are visible.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
angle The angle of rotation. Float, between -45 and +45.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Adjusts color temperature of the image.

remarks.para: Adjusts color temperature of the image.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
scale The value of color temperature. Float, between 0 and 1, with 0 indicating cool, and 1 indicating warm. A value of of 0.5 indicates no change.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Tints the photo with specified color.

remarks.para: Tints the photo with specified color.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
tint The color of the tint. Integer, representing an ARGB color with 8 bits per channel. May be created using android.graphics.Color Color class.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Adds a vignette effect to image, i.

remarks.para: Adds a vignette effect to image, i.e. fades away the outer image edges.
Available parameters:

Parameter nameMeaningValid values
scale The scale of vignetting. Float, between 0 and 1. 0 means no change.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function IsEffectSupported (effectName As String) As Boolean
.method public static hidebysig bool IsEffectSupported(string effectName) cil managed

Docs.summary: Check if an effect is supported on this platform.
Docs.returns: true, if the effect is supported on this platform.

remarks.para: Check if an effect is supported on this platform.
Some effects may only be available on certain platforms. Use this method before instantiating an effect to make sure it is supported.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the effect name is not known.
